awd_titl_txt: REU Site: Increasing Statistical Preparation in Research Education for Underrepresented Undergraduates
awd_abstract_narration:
This project is funded from the Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU) Sites program in the Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences (SBE). It has both scientific and societal benefits, and it integrates research and education. The REU Site "Increasing Statistical Preparation in Research Education for Underrepresented Undergraduates" (INSPIRE U2 Program) will recruit and train 24 underrepresented female students in statistical analyses of big data. It is expected that this initiative will: 1) increase student interest in advanced degree programs; 2) provide support and mentorship to students; and 3) serve as a pipeline for entry into advanced degree programs. Each student will have the opportunity to conduct an independent research project, and in doing so, students will develop the skills, confidence, and inspiration to pursue advanced statistics opportunities within the sciences. Key innovations include: 1) the merging of two evidence-based training approaches; 2) training in the flexible application of knowledge; 3) analysis of data in real world contexts; and 4) intensive one-on-one mentoring and support. The project will have significant impact on science, policy, and society by increasing representation of women and ethnic minorities in statistical and data analysis fields and enhancing the rigor with which scientific research is conducted.

Women of color and minorities are less likely to pursue careers in statistical fields because of lack of uniquely stimulating opportunities and appropriate support within the college environment. Thus, there is a critical need for diverse perspectives in statistical inquiry because there are educational and societal benefits to such diversity. The primary aim of the REU site is to address this need. Each year, for 3 years, approximately 8 underrepresented undergraduate female students who are rising sophomores will receive training in statistical programs and analytical techniques, including modern techniques not commonly included in the undergraduate curriculum. Students will engage in research in a lab with a faculty mentor and develop their own research question, conduct data analyses to answer their research question, and prepare a poster and oral presentation. Finally, students will participate in activities to promote collaborative behavior such as student mentorship, faculty mentorship, panel discussions, professional development activities, and field trips. The overarching goal is diversification among trained individuals with statistical knowledge and skills, leading to the enhancement of the scientific workforce.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The Increasing Statistical Preparation in Research Education for Underrepresented Undergraduates (INSPIRE U2) program is a transformative initiative designed to empower young women to excel in the field of statistics and data science. Launched in 2021, this four-year program made a significant impact on the lives of 25 exceptional female students from renowned universities and colleges across the nation.

At the heart of INSPIRE U2 lies a commitment to fostering a new generation of data-driven leaders. The program's primary goals are to ignite passion for advanced studies in statistical sciences, provide unwavering support and mentorship, and create a robust pipeline of highly qualified women prepared to excel in demanding academic and professional roles.

A cornerstone of the program was the opportunity for each student to conduct independent research projects. This hands-on experience proved invaluable in developing crucial skills, boosting confidence, and igniting a passion for advanced statistical studies. By engaging in rigorous research, students gained a deeper understanding of statistical methods, data analysis techniques, and the scientific process.

The impact of INSPIRE U2 is evident. A significant number of program participants expressed a strong desire to pursue advanced degrees in statistical science or related fields. Four students are currently enrolled in advanced degree programs, demonstrating the program's effectiveness in preparing students for academic success. Moreover, three students have already completed graduate-level degrees.

Beyond academic achievements, INSPIRE U2 fostered a supportive community where students connected with like-minded peers and experienced mentors. Through regular interactions and collaborative projects, students developed valuable soft skills, such as critical thinking, problem-solving, and effective communication.

The program also introduced students to powerful tools like R Studio, empowering them to harness the potential of data. By providing a strong foundation in statistical methods and data analysis techniques, INSPIRE U2 equipped students with the skills they need to succeed in a data-driven world.

INSPIRE U2 is more than just a program; it's a movement. By empowering young women, the program is shaping the future of data science. As INSPIRE U2 continues to evolve, it will undoubtedly leave a lasting legacy, inspiring countless young women to pursue their dreams and make significant contributions to the world of science and technology.
